other_tests.findings: CSF with lymphocytic pleocytosis, hypoglycorrhachia, increased protein, positive cryptococcal antigen.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The first LP showed 434 mg/dL protein and no organisms on Gram stain. The second LP had 442 mg/dL protein and also showed atypical cells that were poorly preserved. The third LP showed 429 mg/dL protein and positive cryptococcal antigen.

other_tests.findings: Granuloma and fungal elements with appearance of Cryptococcus. Positive Grocott methenamine silver (GMS) stain and negative acid-fast bacilli.
Positive cryptococcal antigen in serum with titer 1:80.
